intro: Homogyne sylvestris, commonly known as the forest homogyne, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Homogyne sylvestris thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
